data: Getting Nursing Experience in a Different Health Care System
Isle of Man Department of Health

The idea of the project „Getting Nursing Experience in a Different Health Care System” is to give nursing trainees - during their initial vocational training at the “Fachschule für Gesundheits- und Krankenpflege der Katholischen Kliniken im Märkischen Kreis” - the chance to work in a different healthcare-system for a period of four weeks.
With the “DH Education and Training Centre” (Douglas / Isle of Man) and the “Berit Paracelsus-Klinik AG” (Niederteufen / Switzerland) the Fachschule has found attractive host organisations in the United Kingdom and Switzerland to carry out this project.
The intent of the project is to help trainees to get nursing experience in another healthcare-system, in another organisation with a different structure and other basic conditions. In the course of the project the trainees should compare nursing interventions and strategies in different environments, reflect their experiences and improve their nursing skills. 
Before the trainees will go to the Isle of Man or Switzerland the project coordinators of the three partner organisations will ask them for wishes concerning their practical placements. So it can be realized, that specific interests could be regarded.  
In the Nobles` Hospital on the Isle of Man the practical placements could be:
- a nursing ward (different medical specialization: e.g. internal medicine, surgery)  
- operation theatre
- accident and emergency
- day-procedure suite
- intensive care unit
- hospice
- the community service

In the Berit Paracelsus-Klinik the practical placements could be:
- a nursing ward (different medical specialization: e.g. surgery, orthopedics)
- operation theatre

During the four weeks placement the trainees will always be accompanied by a “registered-nurse” (IOM) or a “Berufsbildner” (Switzerland) who will help to develop the following professional and personal objectives:
- to learn about the health services in the UK (IOM) / Switzerland
- to learn about how multi-professional teams operate in an holistic manner
  by following patients’ through various nursing interventions and advice for specific 
  health needs to promote health an well-being
- to reflect on their experience
- to become more independent in identifying their learning needs
- to gain confidence in communication
- to learn about the culture
- to improve their English (IOM)
